column4: The network in 11.10 crashes at random, a filesystem check is triggered every time I boot, and I can NOT get in remotely with SSH, despite removing IPTables and not having ufw installed.
and this is all on Ubuntu within a VM?
Yes.
had it been working previously, or is it a fresh install that's always been broken?
so what's your priority? Getting ssh access working?
Priority 1: get ssh working so I can SFTP in and grab data off.
Ok, have you done any network troubleshooting? E.g, pinging the VM?
or pinging hosts from within the VM
Good question. Seems I can't ping from the VM to anywhere.
can you pastebin the output of ifconfig?
ok
I only have a local adapter. No network adapter
ok, well revert the VM and let me know what happens
I'm guessing you don't have a snapshot pre-upgrade anymore? :)
If I can get my files off, I can revert to pre-upgrade
Retrieving files now  \:D/
glad it's working for you :)
Sometimes I need someone to slap me into "think through" mode. Thanks!
you can actually mount VMware disk images to read files from them in a lot of situations. Worth knowing for the future if you didn't already
we all do it from time to time :)
Also, I discovered I can have multiple snapshots now, so when I said I had committed the VM, I thought I was overwriting my old snapshots.
snapshots are your friend, especially when it comes to major system changes :)
